patterns: What kind of research oppurtunities are out there ?
How can I get involved in research ?
How to get started with research?
responses: Good question !! Checkout this link https://blogs.illinois.edu/view/6204?ACTION=POST_LIST&displaySearch=RESEARCH%20OPPORTUNITY
Good question !! Checkout the URAP program https://undergradresearch.illinois.edu/programs/urap.html Applications are due October 11

patterns: What all programs do you guys have?
What is the role of Office of Undergraduata Research?
responses: Thanks for asking !! We are the office of undergraduate research. Here are some things that we do : 1) Illinois Undergraduate Research Ambassadors (http://undergradresearch.illinois.edu/programs/ambassadors.html) : Meet my human counterparts !! IURA ambassadors are a group of accomplished undergraduates who are here to help you out in your research journey. Feel free to schedule an appointment with them or with one of our OUR staff 2) Undergraduate Research Apprenticeship Program (https://undergradresearch.illinois.edu/programs/urap.html): Do you want to try out research but don't have any prior research experience ? Turns out we have a program just for you.Just to give you a quick pitch, you fill out an application, we match you with a research mentor, you work with them in the Spring, you take a 3 credit research class and then present your results at the Undergraduate Research Symposium. 3) Undergraduate Research Workshops(https://undergradresearch.illinois.edu/programs/workshops.html' : Whether you are getting started with research or need help in writing proposals, we have a plethora of workshops to support you in every step of your research journey.
Thanks for asking !! Checkout the overview page on our website https://undergradresearch.illinois.edu/programs/explore.html

patterns: How do I email professors for research opportunities ?
responses:
Good question !! Here's my 2 cents on emailing professors :
 1) Email grad students first : They are relatively less busy and will be happy to talk to you about their research.
 2) Keep it short : Professor's are super super .... super busy and no one has the time to go through a really long email. Instead of talking about yourself, just try summarizing their reseaech in 3-4 lines.
 3) Do your Homework : Professor's are very interested in knowing about why you are interested in their research over others
 4) Keep emailing : Chances are you would need to send quite a few emails before you get a reply. So don't give up and keep on following up until you get a clear rejection.
Good question !! Checkout our GSIRW workshop https://undergradresearch.illinois.edu/programs/workshops.html

responses: That's my name.

patterns: What is it like to be a robot
responses: Much the same as being a human, except that we lack all emotions, dreams, aspirations, creativity, ambition, and above all subjectivity.
